summary: This is an email from a federal prosecutor to Roy Black, notifying him of a potential court order to disclose the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Jeffrey Epstein. The email references a lawsuit filed by two victims against the U.S. government, arguing their rights were violated because they were not consulted before the NPA was entered. The sender requests a copy of the NPA as filed under seal in state court by Jack Goldberger to ensure consistent representations to the judiciary.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Recipient of the email notification regarding potential compelled disclosure of the Non-Prosecution Agreement. Likely Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorney.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Filed the Non-Prosecution Agreement under seal in state court in accordance with a judge's order.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in the legal proceedings surrounding the Non-Prosecution Agreement; the email sender is coordinating with Black to obtain a copy of what Goldberger filed.

events.title: Government Response Deadline to Victims' Motion
events.description: Deadline for the U.S. government to respond to the victims' motion asking the court to order production of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Filing of Non-Prosecution Agreement in State Court
events.description: Jack Goldberger filed the Non-Prosecution Agreement under seal in state court pursuant to a state judge's order.

events.title: Victims File Lawsuit Against United States
events.description: Two of Jeffrey Epstein's victims filed a lawsuit alleging the U.S. government violated their rights by not consulting them before entering into the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

keyFacts: A Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) exists between the U.S. government and Jeffrey Epstein, containing a confidentiality provision.
Two of Epstein's victims have sued the U.S., alleging their victim rights were violated because they were not consulted prior to the NPA.
The victims have asked a federal court to order the production of the NPA, potentially compelling its disclosure.
The NPA was previously filed under seal in state court by attorney Jack Goldberger.
Federal prosecutors intend to oppose the motion to produce the NPA, citing its confidentiality provision.
